intro: Piper fulvescens var. igatimiana, commonly known as the Igarapé pepper, is a climbing shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its pinnate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange berries that are edible and have a peppery flavor. It thrives in humid, tropical conditions with partial shade. This variety is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
